column2: Job Title : Transportation Manager Job Summary: We are looking for an experienced Transportation Manager to oversee the planning, scheduling, and supervision of shipments from production to end-users. The role involves tracking orders, ensuring vehicle maintenance, managing driver qualifications, and maintaining compliance with safety regulations. The Transportation Manager will be based in Mathura and will play a crucial role in optimizing transportation processes and ensuring efficient delivery operations. Roles & Responsibilities: 1. Plan and supervise shipments from production to end-users. 2. Schedule daily and weekly routes for transportation vehicles. 3. Track orders using functional systems such as barcodes and tracking software. 4. Ensure proper maintenance of vehicles and conduct regular inspections. 5. Arrange repairs and routine maintenance for transportation vehicles. 6. Ensure all drivers and operators possess the correct and up-to-date qualifications. 7. Reduce the risk of vehicle overloading. 8. Maintain accurate records of transportation activities. 9. Organize team members' schedules and coordinate their activities. 10. Familiarize with safety protocols and legal regulations to ensure secure handling of all transport operations. Requirements: - Bachelor's degree in any stream. - Minimum 5 years of experience as a Transportation Manager. - Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. - Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities. - Ability to work independently and collaboratively. Skills Required: - Excellent Transport Knowledge. - Team-working skills. - Problem-solving skills. - Good time management. - Commercial awareness. - Communication skills. Job Type : Full-time Schedule : Day shift Language:  English, Hindi Experience: - Minimum 5 years of experience as a Transportation Manager.

column1: Vacancies For a Transport Executive @ EuroSchool Whitefield
column2: The roles and responsibilities of a Transport Incharge/Manager typically include: Fleet Management: Overseeing the management of the transportation fleet, including vehicles, drivers, and related equipment. Route Planning and Optimization: Developing efficient transportation routes to ensure timely delivery or pickup & Drop Vehicle Maintenance: Implementing and supervising maintenance schedules for all vehicles to ensure they are in optimal working condition and comply with safety regulations. Driver Management: Recruiting, training, and managing drivers, including monitoring their performance, scheduling shifts, and ensuring compliance with safety regulations and company policies. Safety and Compliance: Ensuring compliance with transportation regulations, including vehicle safety standards, driver qualifications, and transportation laws. Customer Service: Handling customer inquiries, complaints, and feedback related to transportation services, ensuring a high level of customer satisfaction. Logistics Coordination: Collaborating with other departments, such as logistics, procurement, and operations, to coordinate transportation activities and support overall business operations. Technology Integration: Implementing and managing transportation management systems (TMS) or other technology solutions to streamline operations, track vehicle locations, and optimize routes. Risk Management: Identifying potential risks related to transportation operations and implementing strategies to mitigate risks, such as accident prevention measures and insurance coverage. Performance Monitoring and Reporting: Monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs) related to transportation operations, analyzing data to identify areas for improvement, and preparing regular reports for management review. Emergency Response: Developing and implementing emergency response plans for transportation-related incidents, such as accidents, breakdowns, or adverse weather conditions. Regulatory Compliance: Staying informed about changes in transportation regulations and ensuring compliance with local, state, and federal laws governing transportation operations. Continuous Improvement: Identifying opportunities for process improvement and implementing strategies to enhance efficiency, reduce costs, and improve overall transportation operations.
column11: Communication Skills, Team Management Skills, Planning Skills, Management Skills, Interpersonal Skills, Analytical Skills

You??l manage back-to-back pickups and ensure on-time arrivals of cabs and also manage ad-hoc pickups and drops of members and clients. Extension/Renewal of transport agreements and maintaining monthly transport user subscription list. Submit the verified/signed invoice to finance team to process the payment. Follow up with finance team for ensuring timely payment to vendor. Preparation of daily vendor distribution report and total transport cost   Preferred candidate profile     Minimum of 7 years of experience in managing transportation in a corporate environment. Proficient in transport software such as MoveInSync, Route Matic? and be able to handle shifts independently. Strong organizational and administrative skills Capability of handling sudden and multiple BCP situations,? Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills. Proficient in MS Office software (e.g., Excel, Word, PowerPoint)? Proven track record on coordinating housekeeping and cafeteria activities in corporate office? ? ?? Ability to work independently and manage multiple Priorities/processes at the same time and prioritize effectively. Performs well under pressure and meets deadlines effectively. Resourceful and proven effectiveness working with vendors and suppliers. Strong customer service orientation and outstanding customer service skills with ability to interact effectively at all levels Responsiveness to multiple (often ad hoc) requests and strong sense of urgency ?Possesses high energy, a "can-do" attitude, a willingness to take initiative, and a proactive approach to practice and team support ?Flexibility to work longer hours during peak work periods ?Strong and fluent in written and verbal communication skills respectively- able to clearly and concisely convey key information through a variety of communication channels (voice mail, e-mail, face to face)

column2: Position Title:  Associate-Cargo FL (This role is on third-party payroll) Reports to:  Head - Warehouse Operations Location:  Bangalore (Attibele) Position Summary:  The primary objective of the Transporter Management System Coordinator is to oversee and optimize the operations of our TMS (CargoFL), ensuring seamless integration and functionality of the Transporter Management, Inventory Management, and Packing Material modules. Key Objectives: Planning, system optimization, data analysis, and cross-functional collaboration to improve logistics efficiency, reduce costs, and enhance the supply chain's operational effectiveness using TMS. Upgrading the system as per business requirements and aligning the same with the service provider. Providing data-driven insights to stakeholders involved in Forward and Return Journey. Optimizing inventory management and order management of Packing Material across the network. Ensuring end-to-end compliance for TMS and inventory management modules within CargoFL. Ensure accurate inventory tracking and management across multiple locations, optimizing inventory levels to meet operational needs without excess. Key Performance Indicators (KPIs): Freight cost savings Carrier compliance Efficiency and cost control with respect to packing material Inventory coordination with transporters Development as per agreed timelines Organizational Relationships: Internal: Operations Team, Planning Team, and Finance Team. External: Carriers, 3PL Service Providers, and other vendors Eligibility Criteria and Functional Competencies Required: Bachelor's degree in supply chain management, Logistics, Business Administration, or related field. Minimum of 2 years of experience in logistics, supply chain management, or a related role with a focus on transportation and inventory management systems. Strong understanding of SAP, ERP systems, and data analytics tools. Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills. Proven ability to manage cross-functional projects and teams. Effective communication and negotiation skills. Knowledge of Microsoft Tools: Excel, PowerPoint, and BI (optional). Prior TMS knowledge is an added advantage.
column11: Inventory Management, Transport Management, Material Management

column2: The Senior Associate HSE Operations will play a pivotal role in IIHS Environment, Health and Safety management. The incumbent will be expected to help define and implement a robust HSE framework for the Institution, keeping in mind legal compliance and evolving institutional needs. Training IIHS staff, students, and other stakeholders on HSE aspects, conducting regular checks and audits, and ensuring HSE awareness and compliance across the Institutional will be a part of the role.         Activities and Tasks       Responsibilities would include, but not be limited to, the following:       Identifying and supporting the implementation of an EHS legal framework applicable to the operations of the Institution and advising the top management on these matters from time to time;         Preparing the requisite documentation for legal compliance, adherence to applicable national / international standards;         Conducting periodical risk assessments, inspection and observation of processes across all areas including construction, kitchen, recreation zones, conservation zones as well as basic office premises, planning mitigation actions for the identified risks;         Conducting toolbox talks, EHS training for all relevant stakeholders (IIHS staff and students, contract workforce, vendors, etc) and job-specific training as required to ensure safety at the workplace;         Conducting regular periodical checks on relevant agencies like vendors, service providers and contractor companies to ensure adherence to safe working systems and practices;         Conducting HSE audits followed by meetings with contractors and vendors to address the audit observations and implement appropriate improvements in processes and protocols;         Conducting accident investigation, analysing and recommending corrective and preventive actions for any incidents that occur in the Institution or that have an influence on the operations of the Institution;         Developing onsite emergency preparedness and response plans, implementation of the plan including providing the requisite training for roles identified in the plan and conducting periodical mock drills for scenarios identified in the plan;         Taking up any additional responsibility that the Supervisor may set from time to time;         Providing support to other IIHS activities including academics, research, training, practice, operations and others;         Participating in all activities of Institution-Building at IIHS; carrying out tasks as assigned by IIHS; and travelling on IIHS work within the country as and when needed.         Structure and Reporting        The Senior Associate HSE Operations will report to the Lead Administration at IIHS and will be required to collaborate effectively with a diverse group of internal teams and external individuals/organizations, and students.       Person Specification         Basic Qualification:         B.E or B.Tech degree in Civil / Electrical engineering with minimum 6 years experience or a Graduate degree in a science stream with minimum 8 years experience;         Along with a diploma in industrial safety recognised by the DGFASLI (Directorate General of Factory Advice Service & Labour Institutes) or an AICTE (All India Council for Technical Education) affiliated university / institution recognised by the state government of Karnataka;         Preferred experience:        The ideal candidate should:       Have worked in construction companies / B2B real estate companies or tech companies;         Be a Certified Lead Auditor for ISO 45001:2018 safety management systems;         Have working exposure on regulatory matters pertaining to licences, consents, authorisations, and other approvals that are accorded by national / regional / local authorities;         Be able to maintain good interpersonal relationships with staff and students, vendors, contractor companies and others to ensure seamless operations in the Institution;         Key personality traits:         Be confident and articulate;         Have strong networking skills for interaction with all stakeholders of the organisation;         Be punctual and meticulous in all aspects of work; should have an excellent eye for detail;         Language skills:         Should be very comfortable communicating in and comprehending English, Hindi and Kannada; ability to read, write and speak in Kannada is a mandatory requirement.
column11: Training, EHS, Industrial safety, Accident investigation, Networking, ISO, Legal compliance, Safety management, Labour, HSE

column2: Sparsh Global School is looking for Transport Manager to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      As a transport manager, your role involves overseeing the transportation operations of a company or organization      You are responsible for planning, organizing, and managing the movement of goods, materials, or people efficiently and effectively      Here are some key responsibilities and tasks associated with the role of a transport manager:Strategic Planning: Developing transportation strategies and policies that align with the organization's objectives      This includes determining the most cost-effective and efficient transportation routes and modes of transportation      Fleet Management: Managing the company's fleet of vehicles, including procurement, maintenance, and scheduling      This involves ensuring that vehicles are in good working condition, properly licensed, and meet safety and regulatory requirements      Logistics Coordination: Coordinating with suppliers, customers, and other stakeholders to ensure timely delivery of goods or services      This may involve coordinating multiple transportation modes, such as road, rail, air, or sea, to optimize efficiency      Route Optimization: Analyzing transportation routes and developing strategies to minimize costs, reduce fuel consumption, and improve delivery times      This may involve using route planning software, considering traffic patterns, and utilizing real-time data to make informed decisions      Compliance and Regulations: Staying up to date with transportation laws, regulations, and compliance requirements      Ensuring that the company operates in accordance with relevant legislation, such as driver hours, vehicle weight limits, and environmental regulations      Cost Control: Monitoring transportation costs, analyzing expenses, and implementing cost-saving measures      This may include negotiating contracts with transportation providers, optimizing fuel consumption, and reducing maintenance and repair costs
column11: fleet, logistics, route planning, transportation operations, transportation, strategic planning, coordination, operations, cost control, transport operations, transport management, compliance, procurement, supply chain management, fleet management

Seat's, Windows, Doors, vehicle working conditions, battery, tyres, flooring, top, electrical fitments, emergency doors operations, lock's functioning, Quality check, Bus Crew attendance & performance. Fueling, attendance, maintenance, daily fleet status, buses in & out records to be maintained on daily basis & share with TTPL. Data entry in set excel formats & in software portal should be update on daily basis. Centre details i.e. Provide support to internal customers during Field Trips, Events. Handle Parent Queries / Grievances and ensure closure of the same. Manage the repair and maintenance of School Buses, Cars etc. Effective route planning for better cost optimization. Regular CC TV - Monitoring, Operations are in place and maintain back up of recordings for at least one month. Generating MIS on Daily, weekly & monthly and sending it to School & TTPL. Annual Compliances :- Registrations, Taxation, Permits, Insurances (renewals & Claims), Fitness, PUC, RTO norms for school buses. Desired Candidate Profile   Excellent geographical knowledge (intra-city) Candidate should be Graduate/Post Graduate in any discipline Must have 2 - 5 years experience in School Bus operations. Ability to appraise and use computer system and electronic communication methods. Perks and Benefits

column2: DP World  is looking for Transport Manager  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey    As a transport manager, your role involves overseeing the transportation operations of a company or organization      You are responsible for planning, organizing, and managing the movement of goods, materials, or people efficiently and effectively        Here are some key responsibilities and tasks associated with the role of a transport manager:        Strategic Planning: Developing transportation strategies and policies that align with the organization's objectives      This includes determining the most cost-effective and efficient transportation routes and modes of transportation      Fleet Management: Managing the company's fleet of vehicles, including procurement, maintenance, and scheduling      This involves ensuring that vehicles are in good working condition, properly licensed, and meet safety and regulatory requirements      Logistics Coordination: Coordinating with suppliers, customers, and other stakeholders to ensure timely delivery of goods or services      This may involve coordinating multiple transportation modes, such as road, rail, air, or sea, to optimize efficiency      Route Optimization: Analyzing transportation routes and developing strategies to minimize costs, reduce fuel consumption, and improve delivery times      This may involve using route planning software, considering traffic patterns, and utilizing real-time data to make informed decisions      Compliance and Regulations: Staying up to date with transportation laws, regulations, and compliance requirements      Ensuring that the company operates in accordance with relevant legislation, such as driver hours, vehicle weight limits, and environmental regulations      Cost Control: Monitoring transportation costs, analyzing expenses, and implementing cost-saving measures      This may include negotiating contracts with transportation providers, optimizing fuel consumption, and reducing maintenance and repair costs
column11: Procurement, Logistics coordination, Fleet management, Compliance, Manager Strategic Planning, Scheduling, Route planning, Strategy development, Monitoring, Cost control
